title: Regarding the source of the topic /imu/encoder
body: Thank you for your open source work for contributing to the community, I would like to know how your encoder data is emitted from STM32 and received in ROS, can you discuss this with you.
author: Luthermorning

comments.body:
Hi,  the data link path of the encoder message is like this:

Motor --> [Encoder angle packets] --> CAN --> stm32 --> [Timestamping and packing the angle packets together with adjecent IMU packets] --> USART --> Host machine --> ROS serial driver --> [Decode both IMU and angle packets and publish them as `/imu/data` and `/imu/encoder`]

title: Any difference between PV-LIO and the software code of alpha-lidar
body:
Hi!
I have followed you works of PV-LIO and noticed that the software code of alpha-lidar seems to be almost using the same code of PV-LIO. So what is the crucial difference between PV-LIO and alpha-lidar software code ?
author: CharlieV5

comments.body:
Hi! PV-LIO is an under-developing version of Î±LiDAR. There are two main updates of this repo compared with PV-LIO  :
1. Non-static initialization for rapid rotation scenarios.
2. Uncoupled motor encoder fusion.
